d.title: Lodash doesn't work in Browserify
Cannot use lodash on Netlify Edge Runtime (in NextJS middleware)

labels.name: issue bankruptcy
labels.description: Closing the issue/PR to start fresh

d.body:
When I deploy my app to netlify I get an error because it seems lodash uses some function that is not supported in the Edge Runtime (I use it in my middleware). Can somebody with a bit more knowledge about the source code of lodash explain to me why? And if there is any way to use lodash in my next.js middleware without running into this problem?

Node version: 16.17.0
NextJS version: 12.3.0
Lodash version: 14.17.21

```
3:30:14 PM: Failed to compile.
3:30:14 PM: 
3:30:14 PM: ./node_modules/lodash/_root.js
3:30:14 PM: Dynamic Code Evaluation (e. g. 'eval', 'new Function', 'WebAssembly.compile') not allowed in Edge Runtime
3:30:14 PM: Import trace for requested module:
3:30:14 PM: ./node_modules/lodash/isBuffer.js
3:30:14 PM: ./node_modules/lodash/_arrayLikeKeys.js
3:30:14 PM: ./node_modules/lodash/keysIn.js
3:30:14 PM: ./node_modules/lodash/_getAllKeysIn.js
3:30:14 PM: ./node_modules/lodash/pickBy.js
3:30:14 PM: ./src/utils/utils.js
3:30:14 PM: ./src/middleware.js
```

d.title: Different versions of V8 give different string tags for generator functions: _.isFunction
No compatible version found: lodash.upperfirst@^3.0.0
d.body:
Hi,

It looks like lodash.upperfirst < 4.X has been unpublished from npm, I guess this is a mistake? 

Same thing happened earlier this year as well https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/1778


d.title: Fixed memory leak with debounce/throttle arguments and context
d.body:
Noticed that both underscore and lodash hold onto the arguments and context of the last execution of a debounced/throttled function. This leak can be serious (as is was in my app, retaining a giant DOM tree)

underscore just merged my PR for this https://github.com/jashkenas/underscore/pull/1329

lodash's implementation is quite a bit more complex so let me know if I missed a case. As discussed in the underscore PR, there isn't really a way to test this. (Unless you want me to resort to _.debounce.toString().replace + eval trickery to inject some local scoped tests?)

d.title: Lodash >=0.9.2 fails to install on 64-bit Windows 7 (standard user account)
d.body:
There's a couple packages with a dependency on lodash 0.9.2 (most notably grunt 0.4) that fails to install on 64-bit Windows 7 when running a regular user account (this is on an university computer - Node.js is installed properly and works just fine). Lodash 0.8.2 installed just fine, but 1.0.0 RCs also have this same installation issue.

```
210 info install lodash@0.9.2
211 verbose unsafe-perm in lifecycle true
212 silly exec cmd "/c" "node build/post-install"
213 silly cmd,/c,node build/post-install,C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\GitHub\ExLinks\node_modules\lodash spawning
214 info lodash@0.9.2 Failed to exec install script
215 info C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\GitHub\ExLinks\node_modules\lodash unbuild
216 verbose from cache C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\GitHub\ExLinks\node_modules\lodash\package.json
217 info preuninstall lodash@0.9.2
218 info uninstall lodash@0.9.2
219 verbose true,C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\GitHub\ExLinks\node_modules,C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\GitHub\ExLinks\node_modules unbuild lodash@0.9.2
220 verbose C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\GitHub\ExLinks\node_modules\.bin,[object Object] binRoot
221 info postuninstall lodash@0.9.2
222 error lodash@0.9.2 install: `node build/post-install`
222 error `cmd "/c" "node build/post-install"` failed with 127
223 error Failed at the lodash@0.9.2 install script.
223 error This is most likely a problem with the lodash package,
223 error not with npm itself.
223 error Tell the author that this fails on your system:
223 error     node build/post-install
223 error You can get their info via:
223 error     npm owner ls lodash
223 error There is likely additional logging output above.
224 error System Windows_NT 6.1.7601
225 error command "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\\\node.exe" "C:\\Program Files\\nodejs\\node_modules\\npm\\bin\\npm-cli.js" "install" "lodash@0.9.2"
227 error node -v v0.8.15
228 error npm -v 1.1.66
229 error code ELIFECYCLE
230 verbose exit [ 1, true ]
```

It seems to fail when it comes to getting for the [Closure Compiler and UglifyJS](https://github.com/bestiejs/lodash/blob/master/build/post-install.js#L127) (based on the "failed with 127"), and I can't figure out how I could make this work (especially when it's installed as a dependency by another package and makes the installation fail because of it).

d.title: lodash-es - type: module in package.json breaks npm install with some NPM versions
d.body:
We get
```
09:45:34 npm ERR! code EMISSINGARG
09:45:34 
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror Error: Missing required argument #1
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at andLogAndFinish (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:31:3)
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at fetchPackageMetadata (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:51:22)
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at resolveWithNewModule (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/install/deps.js:490:12)
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/install/deps.js:491:7
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/iferr/index.js:13:50
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:37:12
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at addRequestedAndFinish (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:82:5)
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at returnAndAddMetadata (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:118:7)
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at pickVersionFromRegistryDocument (/usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/lib/fetch-package-metadata.js:135:20)
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/iferr/index.js:13:50
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror This is an error with npm itself. Please report this error at:
09:45:34 npm ERR! typeerror     <http://github.com/npm/npm/issues>
```
When running `npm i lodash-es@4.17.13` using certain Node/NPM versions.

Please, remove `"type": "module"` from package.json. This is affecting over 500 modules.

d.title: Prevent command injection through the variable option

labels.name: issue bankruptcy
labels.description: Closing the issue/PR to start fresh

d.body:
This fixes the issue disclosed at https://app.snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-LODASH-1040724

For now, I used a regexp allowing any ES5 identifier for the variable name. The advantage of that is that it avoids BC breaks if some code uses weird variable names. The drawback is that the regexp is big.
If reducing the range of allowed variable names is OK, a smaller regex could be used.

d.title: Prevent ReDoS
d.body: To fix https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/3359, modified reHasUnicodeWord to remove an unnecessary comma which made the regex greedy, this is only a test regex and not a matching regex. Added unit tests, this now should run under 5 ms instead of over 1000 ms for huge 50k+ char words.

d.title: NPM Error - bufferClone.js
d.body: It looks like a new version of `bufferClone.js` introduces a reference error, since the `root` variable is `undefined`.  [Here](https://github.com/lodash/lodash/blob/npm/internal/bufferClone.js#L5) is where the problem is.  Thank you for taking the time to look at this!

d.title: TypeError: Class constructors cannot be invoked without 'new'
d.body:
Using ES6 classes, the native bound function works.

``` javascript
class A {}
var ABound = A.bind(null, 1, 2, 3)
var a = new ABound()
```

Where as using lodash bind function, it doesn't work.

``` javascript
class A {}
var ABound = _.bind(A, null, 1, 2, 3)
var a = new ABound()
```

Following exception is thrown 

``` stack
TypeError: Class constructors cannot be invoked without 'new'
    at new A (repl:1:23)
    at /Users/tusharmathur/Documents/Projects/ioc/node_modules/lodash/index.js:3230:27
    at new wrapper (/Users/tusharmathur/Documents/Projects/ioc/node_modules/lodash/index.js:3653:19)
    at repl:1:5
```

Looking at the code it seems obvious why, but is it the expected behaviour?

d.title: Lodash error (firefox + greasemonkey)
d.body:
Don't know where to report, but anyway, the problem is:
- install greasemonkey on firefox
- install this test script: https://greasyfork.org/en/scripts/5283-testing
- load a greasyfork.org page
- expected: you should see an alert
- actual: nothing, but an error `Permission denied to access property 'toString' lodash.min.js:30`

note: script loads https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/lodash.js/2.4.1/lodash.min.js

d.title: Since v4.0.0, _.isEqual is not consistent over object properties ordering
Debounce bug
d.body: fixes #2089

d.title: Fix issue where _getTag() fails with "TypeError: Expected at least one argument"

labels.name: issue bankruptcy
labels.description: Closing the issue/PR to start fresh

d.body:
Fixes https://github.com/lodash/lodash/issues/4500

On PlayStation 4 and LG WebOS 2, the `Promise.require()` API throws an exception if the argument list is empty.  This causes the application to crash, because the Lodash bundle fails to evaluate.

The fix is to call `Promise.resolve(undefined)` instead.  This is the same solution used by https://github.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/396.
